H0.text: The fossils changed locations, which explains why several seaâ€‘organism fossils were discovered buried deep in an area of dry land.

H1.text: The area had a shift in climate, which best explains why several fossils of sea organisms were discovered buried deep in an area of dry land.

H2.text: The land was once underwater, which explains why several fossils of sea organisms were discovered buried deep in an area of dry land.

H3.text: A glacier once covered the area, explaining why several fossils of sea organisms were discovered buried deep in an area of dry land.

A4.text: Song dynasty Chinese scholar-official Shen Kuo hypothesized that marine fossils found in a geological stratum of mountains located hundreds of miles from the Pacific Ocean was evidence that a prehistoric seashore had once existed there and shifted over centuries of time.

A5.text: Reworked fossils are created by erosion exhuming (freeing) fossils from the rock formation in which they were originally deposited and redepositing them in a younger sedimentary deposit.

A7.text: Depositional environments in ancient sediments are recognised using a combination of sedimentary facies, facies associations, sedimentary structures and fossils, particularly trace fossil assemblages, as they indicate the environment in which they lived.
